property.name: text
property.value: MapReduce is a Ptalon actor that models the Google MapReduce system. It is used to perform distributed computation on a data set, based on user supplied methods called map and reduce. This demo shows an example using a reverse hyperlink graph. To make the demo work, you need to set the fileNamePrefix parameter to a String that points this model to the file $PTII/ptolemy/actor/ptalon/demo/MapReduce/LinkGraph.map, an input data set for this demo. Be sure to leave off the ".map" at the end of the file name. In this model, we set the value of fileNamePrefix to "LinkGraph". The outputs will be stored in $PTII/ptolemy/actor/ptalon/demo/MapReduce/LinkGraph0.red, $PTII/ptolemy/actor/ptalon/demo/MapReduce/LinkGraph1.red, etc. The files show the reverse hyperlink graph of the various words in the input files. For example, if {"stanford", "google"} was in the input, then {"google", "stanford"} is in the output. This can then be summed to obtain the counts of various words in the input files.

property.name: text
property.value: To make your own map reduce system, extend ptolemy.actor.ptalon.lib.MapReduceAlgorithm and implement the map and reduce methods. To create a new instance of this actor, drag out a new PtalonActor from Actors-->HigherOrderActors and set the ptalonCodeLocation to $PTII/ptolemy/actor/ptalon/demo/MapReduce/MapReduce.ptln. Set the className parameter to the qualified class name of your class. In the above example, it's "ptolemy.actor.ptalon.lib.ReverseLink". Create a file similar to ReadTest.map (or LinkGraph.map) with the appropriate input keys and values. ReadTest.map explains how to do this. Set the numberOfMachines parameter to whatever you like, and set the fileNamePrefix as above.
